title: Drawing, "Spring, Summer, Fall.", ca. 1790
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed:la primavera o la gioventu; L'Estate o la fecondita; Autunno e il Sonno.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Loving couple seated between two players of lyres. Woman holds two wreaths over it. Diagonal composition. Girl shown in indistinct action before hermae. At center, seated woman receives filled cornucopia from two children. Another child suckles her right breast. Fourth watches happenings from tree. At right, Silenus lies sleeping upon his back, surrounded by drinking vessels and jars. Girl leans over him, Satyr and another man watching.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Spring, Summer, Fall.", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2254.
